SpaceX: Starship


Starship is a fully reusable transport system in development by SpaceX.

Formerly known as BFR (Big F***ing Rocket), Starship is being designed to transport humans & cargo both on earth and to the moon, Mars & beyond.

Starship is designed to be fully and rapidly reusable.

This means the principal hardware elements are not discarded or allowed to burn up, but instead return to the ground so they can be flown again.


The system is composed of a spacecraft, called Starship, which sits atop a rocket booster called Super Heavy.

The combined system will stand 120m tall, roughly equivalent to a 35-story building

With over twice the thrust of the Saturn V rocket that took humans to the moon, Starship will be the most powerful launch vehicle ever developed.

The Super Heavy Booster possesses 33 Raptor boosters, while the Starship spacecraft possesses 6.

In addition to being among the most advanced engines ever created, Raptor engines are fueled a combination of liquid oxygen & methane

This fuel could theoretically be produced using resources discoverable on the moon or Mars, adding to the rocket's reusability
